content: Basically can we make bytemuck part of core? There is an RFC (already accepted) for safe transmutes, but that is a lot of work, while bytemuck already exists.
bytemuck already is no-std. would there be any benefit putting it in core?

Without the additional magic that the safe-transmute project promises, I don't believe that bytemuck can get any better right now. Adding it to core wouldn't really give it anything new it could deliver.

Once the safe-transmute project stabilizes, bytemuck would (most likely) be able to relax the Pod bound and allow even more casts than are currently possible, including (again, probably) even more slice casts than are currently possible.
